onCreate().Description: Called when your factory is first constructed. The same factory may be shared across multiple RemoteViewAdapters depending on the intent passed.

Returns: The id of the item at the specified position.
Parameters: int: The position of the item within the data set whose row id we want.

onDestroy().Description: Called when the last RemoteViewsAdapter that is associated with this factory is unbound.

Returns: A RemoteViews object corresponding to the data at the specified position.
Parameters: int: The position of the item within the Factory's data set of the item whose view we want.
getViewAt(int).Description: See @B_android#widget#Adapter#getView_E@. Note: expensive tasks can be safely performed synchronously within this method, and a loading view will be displayed in the interim. See @B_android#widget#RemoteViewsService#RemoteViewsFactory#getLoadingView_E@.

Returns: The number of types of Views that will be returned by this factory.
The RemoteViews representing the desired loading view.
getLoadingView().Description: This allows for the use of a custom loading view which appears between the time that @B_android#widget#RemoteViewsService#RemoteViewsFactory#getViewAt_E@ is called and returns. If null is returned, a default loading view will be used.

onDataSetChanged().Description: Called when notifyDataSetChanged() is triggered on the remote adapter. This allows a RemoteViewsFactory to respond to data changes by updating any internal references. Note: expensive tasks can be safely performed synchronously within this method. In the interim, the old data will be displayed within the widget.

Returns: True if the same id always refers to the same object.

ClassDesc: An interface for an adapter between a remote collection view (ListView, GridView, etc) and the underlying data for that view. The implementor is responsible for making a RemoteView for each item in the data set. This interface is a thin wrapper around @B_android#widget#Adapter_E@.
